Unity-MonoBehaviour-Awake.description: Awake is always called before any Start functions. This allows you to order initialization of scripts.

Unity-MonoBehaviour-OnEnable.description: This function is called when the object becomes enabled and active.

Unity-MonoBehaviour-Reset.description: Reset is called when the user hits the Reset button in the Inspector's context menu or when adding the component the first time. This function is only called in editor mode.

Unity-MonoBehaviour-Start.description: Start is called on the frame when a script is enabled just before any of the Update methods are called the first time.

Unity-MonoBehaviour-FixedUpdate.description: MonoBehaviour.FixedUpdate has the frequency of the physics system; it is called every fixed frame-rate frame.

Unity-MonoBehaviour-OnTriggerEnter.description: OnTriggerEnter happens on the FixedUpdate function when two GameObjects collide.

Unity-MonoBehaviour-OnTriggerStay.description: OnTriggerStay is called almost all the frames for every Collider other that is touching the trigger.

Unity-MonoBehaviour-OnTriggerExit.description: OnTriggerExit is called when the Collider other has stopped touching the trigger.

Unity-MonoBehaviour-OnCollisionEnter.description: OnCollisionEnter is called when this collider/rigidbody has begun touching another rigidbody/collider.

Unity-MonoBehaviour-OnCollisionStay.description: OnCollisionStay is called once per frame for every Collider or Rigidbody that touches another Collider or Rigidbody.

Unity-MonoBehaviour-OnCollisionExit.description: OnCollisionExit is called when this collider/rigidbody has stopped touching another rigidbody/collider.

Unity-MonoBehaviour-OnMouseEnter.description: Called when the mouse enters the Collider.

Unity-MonoBehaviour-OnMouseExit.description: Called when the mouse is not any longer over the Collider.

Unity-MonoBehaviour-OnMouseDown.description: OnMouseDown is called when the user has pressed the mouse button while over the Collider.

Unity-MonoBehaviour-OnMouseUp.description: OnMouseUp is called when the user has released the mouse button.

Unity-MonoBehaviour-OnMouseUpAsButton.description: OnMouseUpAsButton is only called when the mouse is released over the same Collider as it was pressed.

Unity-MonoBehaviour-OnMouseOver.description: Called every frame while the mouse is over the Collider.

Unity-MonoBehaviour-OnMouseDrag.description: OnMouseDrag is called when the user has clicked on a Collider and is still holding down the mouse.

Unity-MonoBehaviour-Update.description: Update is called every frame, if the MonoBehaviour is enabled.

Unity-MonoBehaviour-LateUpdate.description: LateUpdate is called every frame, if the Behaviour is enabled.

Unity-MonoBehaviour-PreCull.description: Event function that Unity calls before a Camera culls the scene.

Unity-MonoBehaviour-OnWillRenderObject.description: OnWillRenderObject is called for each camera if the object is visible and not a UI element.

Unity-MonoBehaviour-OnBecameVisible.description: OnBecameVisible is called when the renderer became visible by any camera.

Unity-MonoBehaviour-OnBecameInvisible.description: OnBecameInvisible is called when the renderer is no longer visible by any camera.

Unity-MonoBehaviour-OnPreRender.description: Event function that Unity calls before a Camera renders the scene.

Unity-MonoBehaviour-OnRenderObject.description: OnRenderObject is called after camera has rendered the scene.

Unity-MonoBehaviour-OnPostRender.description: Event function that Unity calls after a Camera renders the scene.

body: private void OnRenderImage(RenderTexture src, RenderTexture dest)
Unity-MonoBehaviour-OnRenderImage.description: Event function that Unity calls after a Camera has finished rendering, that allows you to modify the Camera's final image.

Unity-MonoBehaviour-OnDrawGizmos.description: OnDrawGizmos is called when the gizmos are drawn.

Unity-MonoBehaviour-OnGUI.description: OnGUI is called for rendering and handling GUI events.

Unity-MonoBehaviour-OnApplicationPause.description: Sent to all GameObjects when the playing application pauses or resumes on losing or regaining focus.

Unity-MonoBehaviour-OnApplicationQuit.description: Sent to all GameObjects before the application quits.

Unity-MonoBehaviour-OnDisable.description: This function is called when the behaviour becomes disabled.

Unity-MonoBehaviour-OnDestroy.description: Destroying the attached Behaviour will result in the game or Scene receiving OnDestroy.
